intro: Viguiera nudibasilaris, commonly known as the Mexican ironweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and leaf structures. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun, making it well-suited for xeriscaping. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a rough texture, while its flowers are small and clustered in spherical inflorescences. Viguiera nudibasilaris is known for its hardy nature and ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
